title: game no longer running, feel free to start a new one
body:
Hi there!

as of today i have some strange issues with starting the game, whenever the lobby goes to the actual game, the loading screen pops up, then after about 3 minutes i get a prompt telling: The game is no longer running, feel free to start a new one!.

so i click OK and i get sent back to the client, however, both times this has happened i have been deemed a leaver of the game and the team decided to remake... yesterday night 2 files were scanned and downloaded through the client, could they be causing this issue?

if anybody knows something id like to hear it, i have a 10 min leaver penalty now thanks to this phenomenom... {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

replies.body:
the issue continues, even weirder now, i noticed everytime the game tries to start i actually lose my ethernet connection! i have no idea whats causing it, i have run all diagnostics clientside, and its not the server side either so i suspect its my isp connection.

somehow i lose connection the moment lobby goes to game, this happens more often in draftpick (normal, im not 30 yet), after some checking i noticed my entire router busting out, resetting and then resetting again, seems unlikely but now it occurs every other hour...

before i start yelling at my ISP, is there any other thing that might be causing this phenomenom, 

unfortunately at 20 min leaver penalty now thanks to this bug :s

if anyone knows what to do, please tell me

It sounds like either a file or driver is failing to render the game, and crashing you out after a few minutes.  The downloaded files could very well been the patcher's attempt to repair detected corruptions.  Just in case, you can also use the [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) guide to make sure your settings and files are in shape.  Hopefully that will do the trick!
